title: Cassiopeia Rework explained
body:
I think I've figured out why Cass got the rework she did.  Please note this is just a theory.

Old Cass happened to have the combination of strengths that Riot absolutely hates.

A) Poke
B) Speed Boost
C) Slows
D) good damage per second

Before you go typing in the comments that Cass doesn't have many slows I'd like to point out that she uses {{item:3116}} ridiculously well... possibly better than anyone else in the game.  Now lets take a look at how her rework kinda ruined most of those strengths.

A) Q's AP ratio got trashed and its cooldown increased by 1 second.  W lost over half its base damage.  Deadly Cadence used to allow for a lot more casts of her poke before going OOM.

B) the raw numbers for the speed boost is... well its better at early ranks worse at late ranks so... neutral right?  No.  Q has a 4 second cooldown now and the speed boost still lasts 3 seconds when they used to match.  What makes it worse is that Riot gives Cass 25% CDR at 250 stacks.  That means you can't build CDR early to get back to perma speed boost status.  You have to wait until the point of the game that Riot thinks it is ok for Cass to have that again.

C) The 30% AP amp kinda makes you really want to rush all the 120 AP items instead of {{item:3116}}.  Also rank one of W got a 5 second cooldown increase.  Granted W did get a 10% stronger slow on all ranks but I'm not sure that helps a whole lot.

D) This is the only one of those strengths that didn't get reduced.

The final part is she got turned into a hyper carry.  That means that early game she probably isn't going to want to chase anyone even if her kit still allowed her to do it.

Now why Riot hates that combination of strengths I haven't a clue.  I also haven't a clue why they STILL haven't just come out and told us specifically why they changed Cass the way they did.

replies.body: The alternative explanation he gave earlier was *"doing DoT made Cassiopeia step on Brand's toes because he has a Passive that also dealt DoT"*

> [{quoted}](name=Ginga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2014-12-28T21:24:51.883+0000)
>
> The alternative explanation he gave earlier was *"doing DoT made Cassiopeia step on Brand's toes because he has a Passive that also dealt DoT"*

Funny thing is Cass was a DoT mage before Brand was even released. If anything he stepped on her ~~toes~~ tail.

Sorry, the only thing Riot will not tolerate stepped on are toes.

Since Cassiopeia is toe-less and Brand has toes, it doesn't matter if Cassiopeia came first. She has no toes. Brand has toes, and by royal decree, that means Brand officially came first.

My personal theory is that old Cassiopeia had the kit for a late game hypercarry (namely her E resets giving her a lot of DPS) but wasn't built around it with her gameplay pattern. She was primarily a lane bully and, from what I've heard, didn't do much else besides this, since although she had the potential to deal tons of damage with her E, she didn't have the openings for it. I think Riot wanted to move her away from the devastating-lane-bully-but-lacking-late-game-pressure style (my understanding is that she fell off kind of hard in the late game because there are less openings for a squishy DPS mage to lay down damage. It was a combination of her strengths being too oppressive in the early game and too irrelevant in the late game), and, seeing the potential for the late game playstyle, decided to push that direction full speed (I recall Stashu saying he wanted her to be the "premier late game DPS mage" or something to that effect). Based on all the complaints he might have pushed this direction too far and had to cut back on the other elements of her kit to compensate, so ultimately I think he'll just have to change her into a champ with solid lane phase and solid late game, as oppose to weaker early game and strong late game, which generally seems like the direction he's heading with her right now.

> [{quoted}](name=MrBuffington,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2014-12-28T21:02:49.628+0000)
>
> My personal theory is that old Cassiopeia had the kit for a late game hypercarry (namely her E resets giving her a lot of DPS) but wasn't built around it with her gameplay pattern. She was primarily a lane bully and, from what I've heard, didn't do much else besides this, since although she had the potential to deal tons of damage with her E, she didn't have the openings for it. I think Riot wanted to move her away from the devastating-lane-bully-but-lacking-late-game-pressure style (my understanding is that she fell off kind of hard in the late game because there are less openings for a squishy DPS mage to lay down damage. It was a combination of her strengths being too oppressive in the early game and too irrelevant in the late game), and, seeing the potential for the late game playstyle, decided to push that direction full speed (I recall Stashu saying he wanted her to be the "premier late game DPS mage" or something to that effect). Based on all the complaints he might have pushed this direction too far and had to cut back on the other elements of her kit to compensate, so ultimately I think he'll just have to change her into a champ with solid lane phase and solid late game, as oppose to weaker early game and strong late game, which generally seems like the direction he's heading with her right now.

The old Cass could have a really good early game and really good late game depending on how you built her. But she had a very high risk to keep her power in check. Now she has a weak early game, mediocre late game, and a higher risk than ever.

Right now actually she's pretty solid at all points in the game; I hear a lot of Cass mains can all-in at lvl 2 and win, plus her late game stacks faster with her new passive. I think her main problem is thematically she's still a bit off and not really satisfying to play; she just does more damage is all.

That has always been her problem.


I mean, her being trash made her problems worse yes, but it was something nobody worried about because all you have to do is raise her numbers. Even a monkey can do that.


Her viability was nothing more than a red herring, and now that she isn't trash as pre-4.21, people are incapable of telling apart "viability" with "fun" or "satisfying" or "thematically fitting".

>That has always been her problem.

Well, since the rework; I don't think people had a problem with her before the rework, is what I'm getting at.

(god dammnit the *"go to comment button"* doesn't even work...)


Well yeah, the rework made her into something completely different while at the same time not changing her nearly enough to make the changes work.



However...I will but truthful and say that, even pre-rework had a bit of issue in that area too. However people could overlook it because her Q and W were just so damn satisfying that they forgot about it. Here's the beauty of the old Cassiopeia.


She could focus entirely on Q and W (using E when she really have nothing else to do or when engaged upon)....or she could go focus completely on her E. However the two co-existed apathetically. Nobody cared that the other camp existed.


All Stashu achieved is create a canyon between the two.

>(god dammnit the "go to comment button" doesn't even work...)

I was having issues with it this morning too

>She could focus entirely on Q and W (using E when she really have nothing else to do or when engaged upon)....or she could go focus completely on her E. However the two co-existed apathetically. Nobody cared that the other camp existed.

Sounds a bit like AP and AD Nid (I main AP Nid and suck at AD Nid).

Would you be more in favor of a rework that combined the Cassiopeia playstyles/gave her one defined playstyle, or would you rather the rework stick to the old division?

If it were completely up to me?


**FANTASY:** Give her one defined playstyle where he power revolves around her Poison rather than her E-spam. In fact, I'd go as far as replace the E-spam with something more thematically appropriate and save that mechanic for a new champion where such a thing will be more appropriate.

My rationale for going the polar opposite direction to serve my own side while pissing off the other side is on the grounds that a playstyle revolving around Q and W is what fits Cassiopeia's archetype far better than [**AP Rambo**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/c14Q6h9X-stashu-if-detailed-explanations-arent-working-heres-a-visual-explanation-for-cassiopeias-issues). I'm not against the idea of AP Rambo, but it needs to be in a champion where it is appropriate. You don't see {{champion:111}} jumping around like {{champion:64}} do you?

Believe it or not, my disdain for [AP Rambo](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/c14Q6h9X-stashu-if-detailed-explanations-arent-working-heres-a-visual-explanation-for-cassiopeias-issues) is that this **makes her far too good at defending herself** when engaged upon, which is contrary to a Poison Mage-archetype AND is exactly what resulted in her Q and W being nerfed to shit in the first place.

However tis but a fantasy...
.
.
.
.
.

**REALISTIC:** Stick to the old division and make both styles more or less equally viable just like your Nidalee example. I can give as much a Twitch's ass as the other side can give about there being a playerbase playing differently.
---------------------------
**TL;DR** - I'd favour the former (Fantasy), but I'll fight for the latter (Realistic) because the latter can actually be fought for. Having a truly appropriate Poison Mage is clearly far beyond Riot's capabilities as baffling as it sounds.

Sounds fair, I agree with your Fantasy actually, even though I'm more inclined to play Cass as that AP Rambo (bear in mind I have no idea how to play Cass and probably would just play Ryze instead). Your analysis makes a lot of sense though; Most of the complaints I've seen about the rework are from people who seem to be in the "poison mage" camp instead of the "AP markswoman" camp. I wonder how the Realistic approach would look, though, since this isn't like AD vs AP Nidalee/Tristana/idk...Malzahar since those champions get their split because they're built differently, where Cassiopeia always scales with AP

Unless they actually turn Cassiopeia into someone who has split ratios, like E scales with AD or something?

I suggest giving {{champion:8}} a ride then. He has...his own mountain of issues and his damage doesn't go up to the same levels as Ryze and Cass. But his spammable point and click Q is basically his equivalent of an AA and he's still geared toward late game.

> even though I'm more inclined to play Cass as that AP Rambo

Do you like AP Rambo, or Cass as AP Rambo? For my part, I can only accept AP Rambo on a champion where AP Rambo is appropriate, which has been the crutch of my disdain towards Stashu's rework.

> **my** disdain towards Stashu's rework.

**Our**. The word is **our**. There are several players who also want the same.
Christ on a bike I get shit on for using plural nouns when talking about Cassiopeia rework and now I can't even use singular nouns :/

Haha, I actually don't like the machine gun style *that* much, I prefer Ryze for that role if anything (and in mid lane, not top; top was just stupid cheese, mid Ryze was fun). I main AP Nidalee for a reason, let's just say, lol.

I'm not sure I was trying to make any sort of definite statement; I just remember the first time I played Cass and read her skills/wiki page, I thought she was supposed to be that E focused champion because the way her E resets worked. I think the playstyle works better on Ryze or Vladmir because they become off-tanks in the late game; Cassiopeia is usually pretty squishy throughout and doesn't have quite the same CC/escape as the two (her ult is good CC, but it's conditional, and an ult, not a basic ability like Ryze).

> [{quoted}](name=MrBuffington,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2014-12-29T03:27:18.993+0000)
>
> Right now actually she's pretty solid at all points in the game; I hear a lot of Cass mains can all-in at lvl 2 and win, plus her late game stacks faster with her new passive. I think her main problem is thematically she's still a bit off and not really satisfying to play; she just does more damage is all.

Are we talking about the same champion? If I lose the lane to a post-rework Cass I will seriously consider uninstalling. I have stomped her every single time I have versed her in mid since her rework. The last one was a hardcore Cass main and it wasn't even a competition. Her team won but it definitely wasn't Cass who carried. Every time I have played as her I have done average at best since the rework. That is coming off a 10 game win streak about 2 weeks prior to the rework.
I'm talking about 4.21 Cass, she received some significant buffs, not enough to make her the lane bully she used to be but certainly enough that she can all in lvl 2 vs unsuspecting players.
Look you don't have to like the Cass rework. But don't call her weak lol. She's VERY strong at the moment because she got free buffs from complainers.

> [{quoted}](name=MrBuffington,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2014-12-28T21:02:49.628+0000)
>
> My personal theory is that old Cassiopeia had the kit for a late game hypercarry (namely her E resets giving her a lot of DPS) but wasn't built around it with her gameplay pattern. She was primarily a lane bully and, from what I've heard, didn't do much else besides this, since although she had the potential to deal tons of damage with her E, she didn't have the openings for it. I think Riot wanted to move her away from the devastating-lane-bully-but-lacking-late-game-pressure style (my understanding is that she fell off kind of hard in the late game because there are less openings for a squishy DPS mage to lay down damage. It was a combination of her strengths being too oppressive in the early game and too irrelevant in the late game), and, seeing the potential for the late game playstyle, decided to push that direction full speed (I recall Stashu saying he wanted her to be the "premier late game DPS mage" or something to that effect). Based on all the complaints he might have pushed this direction too far and had to cut back on the other elements of her kit to compensate, so ultimately I think he'll just have to change her into a champ with solid lane phase and solid late game, as oppose to weaker early game and strong late game, which generally seems like the direction he's heading with her right now.

But the thing is, they didn't actually give her any tools to make her a late game DPS mage aside from spell vamp (which is a nice touch; there's a reason ADCs build lifesteal). Her play pattern and kit still support a lane bully playstyle thanks to her excellent range and the intrinsic zoning in her Twin Fang + ult, but their efforts to make her fit into the late game were literally just "make her do more damage late game". She's still an excellent duelist and poor team fighter, i.e a poor hyper carry and excellent laner. 

One of the many problems with the rework is that they didn't actually help any of her problems in team fights outside of giving her a bit of sustain to mean she blows up slower. Her ult is still unreliable, her AOE DOT (main team fight strength) is now worthless... in a team fight she's a more conditional ADC. Her kit would make sense on a late game splitpusher but only if she could shred turrets.

She was probably never meant to be this "AP Marksmen" from the beginning. And if she was, the designer did a terrible job as her kit doesn't allow her to be one...and the fact **that it doesn't even fit her thematically at all.**

A late game AP Marksmen would be someone like Azir who has the range, escape, and the sufficient self-peel to perform his job...and even THEN he is extremely vulnerable late game due to his inherent squishiness and his escape requiring him to use a soldier up.

> Her kit would make sense on a late game splitpusher but only if she could shred turrets.

And also be more mobile.


Most champions have a decent speed boost or some leaping ability to get away. *"Standing still to cast her Q in hopes of hitting a champion to get that speed boost"*-doesn't make a great escape. It works for initiating a fight in a 1v1 scenario, but that's about it.

yep, basically; they just modified her damage curve so she gets a ton of AP late game, no real utility to help her get her spells down, just made it so she needs to hit fewer spells to kill things because she has a ton of AP

I've posted a lot on other threads suggesting some utility buffs to help give her openings to get her old damage down (my favorite is a short fear on her ult instead of the 2 second slow, keeping the stun she has, that way she gets some consistent hard CC), as oppose to just giving her tons and tons of damage

> My personal theory is that old Cassiopeia had the kit for a late game hypercarry (namely her E resets giving her a lot of DPS) but wasn't built around it with her gameplay pattern.


You are correct.


And literally nothing has changed about her to make her any better at it beyond *"she can get tons of AP to do even more damagez"*. What he did succeed at is alienate the people who actually played her. Her weaknesses are exactly the same as before, and in fact he added an extra one as well because reasons.



Also I'd argue that hyper-carry who also lane-bullies aren't a completely new thing, {{champion:18}}  {{champion:96}}  and {{champion:13}} all have the potential to be hyper-carries, Ryze is a bit on the edge, but still counts. Yet all 3 are massive bullies too, with Kog, he's a bit later than the other two. But overall they're massive lane bullies despite their late games.

eh, those aren't really lane bullies so much as they don't get as destroyed in lane; Ryze is still a short range mage, he just became a lane bully when he went to top lane and played against melee champions, in mid lane he'd be a bit more even/weaker in early lane. Tristana is similar; she can trade with her E but that's about it, most other ADCs have better poke or waveclear ability; Tristana has a tiny bit of trading potential with her E (which is getting reworked) and auto attacks, that's about it. Kog is still super squishy and has short range whenever his W is on cooldown.

There are, however, lane bullies that still have strong late games (aren't hypercarries, but still strong); Orianna, Draven, and Syndra come to mind.

Ah, unless you're up against Lucian, I can safely tell you that Tristana's E let's her do more than just trade.

It's total duration plus the fact that it reduces healing REALLY adds up to something fierce. Add in the extra burst from her W and R and you have a Marksmen's worst nightmare.

I'm not saying Tristana's E is useless, it's a good harass spell no doubt (it's a huge pain vs AP Trist), but comparing to the harass of other ADCs, it's on the lower end, it has a decent cooldown, it is gated by her AA range (550, much lower than other champion's harass), it doesn't scale with AD, and thus generally it falls off. Using her W for damage is a huge risk since it's her escape; she doesn't have the 100-0 potential of an assassin (at least until late game), so you have to be really freaking sure that you can get the reset faster than the enemy can kill you. Her R is a self-peel tool or an 'execute', in most cases will push the enemy outside of her range so she can't attack them anymore. Tristana has a strong lvl 1 because of her E, and then is pretty weak until she gets her items; most of her kit is built around playing defensively. She's not horrifically weak in lane, she's no Vayne, but she's certainly not Lucian or Draven or something. Champions aren't balanced in a vacuum. Even hypercarries need something to keep them afloat in lane so that they can get to late game; why do you think reworked Cassiopeia was such a problem?

Tristana...is actually a very unique case.

You are correct to say that her spells all fall off and end up as purely utility abilities by mid-late games. Her abilities literally serve to be her bread and butter and is completely dropped as the game goes on as they don't scale one bit as she turns 180 and go the complete opposite direction.

But her early game damage is strong enough for her to actually beat a lot of marksmen, or at the very least wear them down and outlast them with enough E's. Obviously she's not the ultimate laning marksmen, but considering her relative strength among most marksmen and into context that GODLY late game of hers...

I think you're wildly overstating her strengths. Any marksman can win a trade, you're supposed to trade back to mitigate that. If the tristana player is good and her opponent is bad, no doubt she's going to have a better chance of winning that lane. Most other marksmen have more tools to trade than Trist, the reason she has a strong lvl 1 is that she gets her trading tool then, where some other ADCs need a few levels to get their potential.

Tristana is a unique case since she's pending rework. I've made my case for her and I'm leaving it at that, since it doesn't even relate to the thread.

>Cassiopeia Rework explained 

Cassiopeia was fine but needed some minor number tweaks to balance out the power she got from the QoL fixes.

However, Riot decided to randomly rework her, destroying her kit, playstyle and identity as a champion in the process.

There, explained.

From what I could pick apart from Stashu's many different explanations, they ****ed her over with the rework because pre-rework she...

a) Did decent damage with her Q...which isn't a problem in and of itself, but...

b) Her E was stupid powerful, to the point where no champion could really afford to get close to her lest she E-spams


They didn't like how she could harass with her Q, and unless the opponent also have decent range, they couldn't answer for it because her E held too much raw power to make any interactivity an impossibility.


Now WHY Riot decided go on a drunk rampage and remove everything that made Cassiopeia enjoyable just so he can have his slithering E-button rather than actually try to balance or preserve what made people like Cassiopeia...I have no god damn clue.

> I have no god damn clue.

A. She now runs out of mana if not careful.

B. She needs the creeps for items and new itemization due to no passive. Cause current one is NOT a passive. Cause IT does NOT help you. Cause IT keeps you DOWN. Cause GG.

C. She also need stacks for full potential.

D. We still are here without a refund. Why? no clue.

> Now why Riot hates that combination of strengths I haven't a clue. 

This is the easy one, because it promoted an anti-interaction playstyle. Old Cass could lay down poke for days, and there wasn't much your opponent could do about it. You had to wait until she made a bad move, called for your jungler, or just suffer. She could even afk waveclear so ganking her was still a pain. Mind you, new Cass has issues of her own, but atleast she involves good interaction with the opponent, which is an infinetly better scenario.

> [{quoted}](name=Narasimha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2014-12-28T18:32:49.388+0000)
>
> This is the easy one, because it promoted an anti-interaction playstyle.

{{champion:103}} Anti {{champion:105}} interaction {{champion:238}} playstyle {{champion:157}}

> [{quoted}](name=Nielarken,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=00000003,timestamp=2014-12-28T20:58:34.524+0000)
>
> {{champion:103}} Anti {{champion:105}} interaction {{champion:238}} playstyle {{champion:157}}

I don't think you understand what anti-interaction playstyle actually means.
Don't get me wrong, hate those champs, but that's not what it is.

"This is the easy one, because it promoted an anti-interaction playstyle. Old Cass could lay down poke for days, and there wasn't much your opponent could do about it. You had to wait until she made a bad move, called for your jungler, or just suffer. She could even afk wave clear so ganking her was still a pain."
sounds familiar the very "problem" that was stated about cass is allowed for these champions. each of these champions force people to want to have no interaction in the laning phase and just tower hug.

So anti interaction isn't getting hit with one CC effect and watching your health completely go?

  It isn't having your ults get cancelled from a 7 second cooldown invulnerable AOE effect, gap closers, missing % health damage over time, grievous wounds, and a Nasus W with a knockup and massive damage?

It isn't limitless juking potential, poke, hybrid damage, and ignoring armor once the builds are halfway done?

It isn't being unable to outrun him if your minions are next to you?  Or free % armor penetration once someone knocks you up?

You and I have VERY different definitions for non interactive.

> [{quoted}](name=Remlap1223,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=0000000300000001,timestamp=2014-12-28T22:46:28.996+0000)
>
> So anti interaction isn't getting hit with one CC effect and watching your health completely go?
> 
>   It isn't having your ults get cancelled from a 7 second cooldown invulnerable AOE effect, gap closers, missing % health damage over time, grievous wounds, and a Nasus W with a knockup and massive damage?
> 
> It isn't limitless juking potential, poke, hybrid damage, and ignoring armor once the builds are halfway done?
> 
> It isn't being unable to outrun him if your minions are next to you?  Or free % armor penetration once someone knocks you up?
> 
> You and I have VERY different definitions for non interactive.

Yeah no, "annoying things" =/= "non-interactive things".

> [{quoted}](name=MotherTeresa1910,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=00000003000000010001,timestamp=2014-12-29T22:14:20.302+0000)
>
> Yeah no, "annoying things" =/= "non-interactive things".

For Yasuo and Fizz, I agree with Remlap. Not because they aren't interactive, but because they have the ability to *deny interaction*. They are able to prevent you from affecting them somewhat frequently due to their kit. :\

No lol, literally none of those are "non-interaction"

Non interaction is Vlad or Yorick, who have so much sustain, you best bet is to never fight them when they're doing well. If you get behind, don't even try to fight/kill them.
Non interaction is Irelia, who gets a stun if you try and fight her. You are PUNISHED for trying to kill her.

Non interaction means the best option is to NOT participate. See when Athenes is OP, the best strategy is to sit back and farm. You don't ever want to do anything but afk cs.

Fizz can dodge your Ult. Yasuo can block your CC. That doesn't mean you just never fight them. It means you need to outplay them. You can't outplay Vlad's Q.
Yet they are ok with with Assassins blowing people up.  If Cass tries to kill you at least you have time to try to do something.

> [{quoted}](name=Narasimha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=euwozeA8,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2014-12-28T18:32:49.388+0000)
>
> This is the easy one, because it promoted an anti-interaction playstyle. Old Cass could lay down poke for days, and there wasn't much your opponent could do about it. You had to wait until she made a bad move, called for your jungler, or just suffer. She could even afk waveclear so ganking her was still a pain. Mind you, new Cass has issues of her own, but atleast she involves good interaction with the opponent, which is an infinetly better scenario.

The Cass you describe sounds brokenly OP. But her 1% pick rate and 0 % banrate suggest that she wasn't.

I played the old Cass a lot. I certainly don't remember this no-interaction play style you speak of. Indeed she could do really well in lane. She could also do really bad because she had a ton of counters.

what most people don't understand is almost every champion sounds broken op when you state there abilities like that. People copy ansd paste them into every circle jerking or hate thread and don't realize even urgot and old sion and heimer sounded op when you put there abilities like that.
*"Jinx is OP because she has an Ashe R that does % damage, a Nidalee Spear that also slows, Tristana's AS steroid, Kog'maw's range, and splash damage ALL AT THE SAME TIME!"*
So basically she was like the majority of popular AP mids and tops throughout LoL's history.

its mostly all number changes tho. they change the number values of a lot of champs and they still work fine. for example they supposedly "nerfed the hell" out of Irelia yet because her kit in general is so strong she still does phenomenally well against a lot of matchups or another rework they've done is Skarner which while yes his new kit is very different from how it originally was its still very strong with all the nerfs to his numbers and changes to some of his abilities 

imo despite all the changes to Cass she still has a very strong kit that with the right build can still do fine against many of the fotm champs. her kit is meant for her to try and wait till late game where she can just sit in the back and spam away with her skills and kill shit almost instantly. just learn to play with her new kit instead of QQing about it :L

you can blame Rito all you want but its not gonna change anything. they've had their minds set on her kit being something like this for awhile and they've said they're still keeping an eye on how well or not well she does and are working on her kit right now more than likely since there were PBE changes for her awhile back that were actually buffs
